3e296525-6133-41b7-b546-f734ddaa3d26.description: Certified LabVIEW Associate Developers (CLAD) demonstrate familiarity with the LabVIEW programming environment and basic programming concepts like data acquisition and manipulation. CLADs possess a working knowledge of the LabVIEW environment, a basic understanding of coding and documentation best practices, and the ability to read and interpret existing code.
3e296525-6133-41b7-b546-f734ddaa3d26.name: Certified LabVIEW Associate Developer

5f7f429e-709e-4355-b1f3-f059fdc88753.description: Certified LabVIEW Developers (CLD) demonstrate proficiency in translating requirements documents into an effective, efficient, and documented LabVIEW programs. CLDs know and use LabVIEW development best practices, minimizing development time and ensuring application maintainability through proper documentation and style.
5f7f429e-709e-4355-b1f3-f059fdc88753.name: Certified LabVIEW Developer

badge_template_activities.title: Pass proctored practical exam within 4 hours

8ab5fa04-6f47-44c6-bf78-6d8726f02f9e.description: LabVIEW Environment badge earners can demonstrate familiarity with the built-in tools and key features of the LabVIEW environment. Given a project, the badge earner can navigate the environment, execute a VI, and validate and test hardware connected to the system.
8ab5fa04-6f47-44c6-bf78-6d8726f02f9e.name: LabVIEW Environment

ddf4b542-8cd3-4a26-9c20-402c760b4dea.description: LabVIEW Programming Fundamentals badge holders can build functional VIs that effectively use structures, clusters and arrays. The badge earner is able to identify order of execution from dataflow paradigm and use LabVIEW to build simple VIs with bundled data, loops, arrays and SubVIs.
ddf4b542-8cd3-4a26-9c20-402c760b4dea.name: LabVIEW Programming Fundamentals

12ba3a3a-0375-4f62-bb02-336e9d1d463f.description: LabVIEW Sequential Programming badge holders can build a readable, modular and scalable sequencer VI. The badge earner can develop modular sequential VIs for single use, one-off applications. The badges earner can use the Open-read-write-close model for accessing resources in LabVIEW.
12ba3a3a-0375-4f62-bb02-336e9d1d463f.name: LabVIEW Sequential Programming

4cdf8a8b-dbb2-4ced-8464-ba582aa0e021.description: LabVIEW Troubleshooting Code badge holders can use LabVIEW troubleshooting tools to debug LabVIEW code. This badge holder can use LabVIEW troubleshooting tools to identify the probable cause of broken run arrows, errors generated when code is run, and unexpected results in data collection and analysis.
4cdf8a8b-dbb2-4ced-8464-ba582aa0e021.name: LabVIEW Troubleshooting Code

fb9a45c2-58a2-4bdd-a30c-350a978cfaef.description: LabVIEW Programming badge holders can build a simple looping or sequencer VI from scratch for single-shot use. This badge earner is able to use the LabVIEW environment, dataflow programming, and common LabVIEW development techniques. They can create applications using the state machine design pattern to acquire, process, display, and store real-world data.
fb9a45c2-58a2-4bdd-a30c-350a978cfaef.name: LabVIEW Programming

bddbb5a7-d545-4015-9533-3fc485956f2c.description: Certified LabVIEW Architects (CLA) demonstrate mastery in understanding technical requirements, architecting a LabVIEW program, and setting up the project for effective project management. CLAs can build a practical VI hierarchy and project plan for delivering an application that meets high-level requirements. CLAs design the application architecture and manage the development of individual components by other engineers, providing technical leadership and guidance on development best practices.
bddbb5a7-d545-4015-9533-3fc485956f2c.name: Certified LabVIEW Architect

badge_template_activities.title: Pass proctored practical exam within 4 hours

44d2955d-8b79-48a3-9b28-8489ff74c5de.description: NI-DAQmx Programming badge holders understand the functions used to program data acquisition devices and the benefits of different options. This badge holder can use the NI-DAQmx driver to measure, generate, and synchronize data acquisition tasks. They can program finite or continuous acquisitions and implement best practices for hardware or software timing, triggering, and logging.
44d2955d-8b79-48a3-9b28-8489ff74c5de.name: NI-DAQmx Programming

5f25fd94-9748-40d9-b199-675471961ed9.description: Certified TestStand Developers (CTD) demonstrate core knowledge and skill in the design, development, and integration of automated production tests in the TestStand environment. CTDs can develop, debug, and deploy parallel, multithreaded test applications while minimizing development time and ensuring maintainability. CTDs know how to develop test steps, monitor and report test results with TestStand data storage and data passing mechanisms, and configure test sequences.
5f25fd94-9748-40d9-b199-675471961ed9.name: Certified TestStand Developer

badge_template_activities.title: Pass proctored practical exam within 4 hours

714e941d-4080-4f58-84b9-e5b7e979097c.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated their ability to read and predict how LabVIEW code will execute. They have a strong understanding of the dataflow paradigm that LabVIEW is based on, can identify basic LabVIEW nodes and structures and data types.
714e941d-4080-4f58-84b9-e5b7e979097c.name: LabVIEW Syntax

5cfa3840-7f0a-40e2-8e48-e92a20120bd9.description: Measurement Fundamentals badge holders understand the basic concepts of measurement including measurement accuracy, acquisition rates, and signal conditioning. This badge holder can make basic analog and digital measurements, select the right DAQ hardware based on resolution, range, and sensitivity, and correctly wire the system with proper grounding techniques.
5cfa3840-7f0a-40e2-8e48-e92a20120bd9.name: Measurement Fundamentals

ab60bd4b-cfa1-4b72-9ed6-a49e009439e5.description: Sensors and Signals badge holders understand the different types of signals and the sensors used to measure those signals. This badge holder can select the appropriate sensor for signals such as strain, vibration, and position as well as possesses a foundational knowledge of sensor configuration and connectivity to data acquisition hardware.
ab60bd4b-cfa1-4b72-9ed6-a49e009439e5.name: Sensors and Signals

422f264e-da3e-42b8-b1be-13aea077041e.description: A LabVIEW programmer with this badge can use the channel wire feature in LabVIEW 2016 or later to depict asynchronous data flow and simplify the programming involved in data transfer between two or more parallel loops. A Channel Wire Communication badge holder knows when to use channel wires verses other LabVIEW data transfer mechanisms.
422f264e-da3e-42b8-b1be-13aea077041e.name: Channel Wire Communication

545efd5e-c667-4fa7-a91e-7f692a941d7d.description: Earners of this badge have shown their understanding of how common LabVIEW design patterns are structured, how they execute, and when to use them. Design patterns covered in this assessment include State Machines, Producer Consumer and Queued Message Handler.
545efd5e-c667-4fa7-a91e-7f692a941d7d.name: LabVIEW Design Patterns

e220bcff-7077-4fd9-bb1f-03e9cceb96a7.description: Earners of this badge can open, run, interpret and troubleshoot a wide variety of LabVIEW applications. Earners of this badge have an understanding of LabVIEW Syntax, including Object Oriented Programming, basic LabVIEW Design patterns and troubleshooting LabVIEW code. This badge is earned by acquiring a set of required badges.
e220bcff-7077-4fd9-bb1f-03e9cceb96a7.name: LabVIEW Diagnostics

f8646121-a111-4de5-9bad-2c31b34e6c1c.description: Certified TestStand Architects (CTA) demonstrate mastery of the TestStand environment, including user interface design and advanced TestStand Engine customization. CTAs are experts in architecting and project managing test systems from high-level specifications. CTAs can translate TestStand specifications to design documents for use by other engineers, customize the TestStand framework, and use established development guidelines and best practices.
f8646121-a111-4de5-9bad-2c31b34e6c1c.name: Certified TestStand Architect

97786539-f5f5-4180-8a35-09e94ab3cece.description: The badge earner understands what classes are and how they can organize code. The badge earner knows how to limit the data any given VI can access to create more maintainable code.
97786539-f5f5-4180-8a35-09e94ab3cece.name: LabVIEW Object Oriented Fundamentals

a899b99e-69c9-41a3-822b-2f7577a0a93d.description: NI Certified Professional Instructors (CPI) are qualified to teach NI training courses and maintain at least one technical certification in NI Software. CPIs demonstrate technical skills as well as teaching capabilities, including managing course timing, facilitating student exercises and technical discussions, and effectively demonstrating course topics with NI Products.
a899b99e-69c9-41a3-822b-2f7577a0a93d.name: NI Certified Professional Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate teaching acumen by teaching a course with assessor

eb644f4a-079c-4f04-a224-3d58312004e6.description: The badge earner can build readable, performant user interfaces that enhance functionality and user experience. The badge earner can use an Event Structure to manage front panel changes, programmatically control the UI, and build a readable UI that matches the user's workflow. This badge is earned by passing the related assessment.
eb644f4a-079c-4f04-a224-3d58312004e6.name: LabVIEW User Interface Development

f9078a2d-f2f5-480c-82bf-adfaacc6fd7c.description: Given an organization's or project's data management strategy, this badge owner is able to capture and store data and metadata to an acquisition file that can be easily managed, analyzed, and reported.
f9078a2d-f2f5-480c-82bf-adfaacc6fd7c.name: Documenting Measurement Data

23fd2932-ee53-4c13-9084-26387442ce3b.description: TestStand Sequence Editor Navigation badge earners can configure and run existing test sequences in the TestStand Sequence Editor. The badge earner can navigate the TestStand Sequence Editor and, given an existing Test Program, execute it and view results.
23fd2932-ee53-4c13-9084-26387442ce3b.name: TestStand Sequence Editor Navigation

244c0ade-bdec-423c-8c7f-1e8f3a0209e6.description: The badge earner can choose and implement appropriate mechanisms to communicate across parallel loops. The badge earner can use parallel design patterns, synchronize parallel loops, and prevent race conditions. This badge is earned by passing the related assessment.
244c0ade-bdec-423c-8c7f-1e8f3a0209e6.name: LabVIEW Parallel Programming

49a4ad1d-0c99-49c6-89e8-c1cc9b3cce21.description: The badge earner can use LabVIEW Application Builder to build executables and installers. The badge earner can prepare code for deployment, build and debug the application, and create a distribution with all the necessary dependencies. This badge is earned by passing the related assessment.
49a4ad1d-0c99-49c6-89e8-c1cc9b3cce21.name: LabVIEW Application Building

4a437b28-4208-44b6-8968-ff4c08d00bc5.description: This badge earner has demonstrated an understanding of data acquisition technologies including sensors, data acquisition hardware, and the LabVIEW software environment. This badge earner can build a custom measurement solution using LabVIEW and NI data acquisition hardware to visualize and analyze real-world signals to make data-driven decisions.
4a437b28-4208-44b6-8968-ff4c08d00bc5.name: Taking Physical Measurements

e1b0b7c9-7554-4d91-af39-e41443aa6d6c.description: The badge earner can follow software engineering best practices and use LabVIEW tools to ensure code quality. The badge earner is familiar with project management, functional tracking, testing, style, deployment and package management, and process automation best practices. This badge is earned by passing the related assessment.
e1b0b7c9-7554-4d91-af39-e41443aa6d6c.name: LabVIEW Software Engineering Principles

b16ac9e4-12af-46e4-9076-3a90c307c075.description: The badge earner appreciates object-oriented design and implementation, is aware of the advantages and pitfalls of LabVIEW classes, and recognizes where these tools can help improve the scalability and modularity of code. The badge earner has the tools to write entry-level object-oriented code.
b16ac9e4-12af-46e4-9076-3a90c307c075.name: LabVIEW Object Oriented Programming

eda9663c-05bc-468d-aa53-f87c96304333.description: Given a measurement need, select the appropriate instrument and implement signal connectivity best practices for accurate and safe measurement. This badge earner is familiar with a variety of instruments and their basic capabilities, including oscilloscopes, DMMs, Programmable Power Supplies, Logic Analyzer and BERTs, function generators and others.
eda9663c-05bc-468d-aa53-f87c96304333.name: Instrument Fundamentals

51fe18ac-25c3-4b0b-b302-20e4a29eda2f.description: DQMH Framework badge holders understand the basic concepts of creating an application using the Delacor Queued Message Handler. Badge earners understand when to use the different DQMH module types, how to extend the default modules and design applications with multiple DQMH modules communicating together. They understand the different DQMH event types and how to use them and are familiar with the DQMH productivity tools. *DQMH is a trademark of Delacor, LLC.
51fe18ac-25c3-4b0b-b302-20e4a29eda2f.name: DQMH Framework

50c19a5e-c51c-4e0e-b2e7-c85e46ec86aa.description: The badge earner can use TestStand to develop a functional test sequence that calls existing code modules. The badge earner can use variables and expressions to manage data in a sequence file; add, configure, and troubleshoot test steps; and control sequence execution flow. This badge is earned by passing the related assessment.
50c19a5e-c51c-4e0e-b2e7-c85e46ec86aa.name: TestStand Test Sequence Development

3c54d009-a5f2-4956-9f5d-e293c174d718.description: Certified LabVIEW Embedded Systems Developers (CLED) demonstrate expertise in designing and deploying embedded systems using LabVIEW, LabVIEW Real-Time, and LabVIEW FPGA. CLEDs can analyze requirements and develop reliable mission-critical embedded control and monitoring applications based on CompactRIO, Single-Board RIO, and/or R Series hardware. A CLED efficiently uses best practices and software engineering principles to design modular, scalable, and maintainable embedded systems.
3c54d009-a5f2-4956-9f5d-e293c174d718.name: Certified LabVIEW Embedded Systems Developer

badge_template_activities.title: Pass proctored practical exam within 5 hours
Become Certified LabVIEW Developer or Certified LabVIEW Architect

daa777d0-a85b-4ab0-aa36-368cc3a3d1e7.description: This badge holder has a foundational understanding of AC signals, including signal type, composition, and analyzing the signal in the time and frequency domains. This badge earner is able to improve the measurement quality of AC signals by applying their knowledge of the relationships between signal bandwidth, noise, and instrument features.
daa777d0-a85b-4ab0-aa36-368cc3a3d1e7.name: AC Signals

7cd15030-2f76-4c10-a9c6-58c3a1825881.description: A LabVIEW Developer can interpret a software design document and implement a solution in LabVIEW while following best practices for software development. Badge earners have demonstrated their ability to build functional user-friendly applications using LabVIEW. This badge is earned by acquiring a set of required badges.
7cd15030-2f76-4c10-a9c6-58c3a1825881.name: LabVIEW Application Development

92e1462c-3c70-4456-9109-e4134b84922d.description: TestStand Debugging Sequences badge earners can use TestStand debugging tools to identify and fix runtime errors in an existing sequence file. This badge earner can debug code modules to trace the source of unexpected behaviors and manage memory between TestStand and code modules.
92e1462c-3c70-4456-9109-e4134b84922d.name: TestStand Debugging Sequences

7c6022ee-ca40-4ebb-aff3-225e6fa8a9d9.description: Earners of this badge have displayed skills related to acquiring and sourcing low level signals from precision instruments such as DMMs and source measure units. Topics include configuring instrument settings, cabling and fixturing, noise rejection, and interpreting specification documents.
7c6022ee-ca40-4ebb-aff3-225e6fa8a9d9.name: DC Signals

ede891b2-af4a-4235-ac38-dc22abd7fcba.description: Given an existing test sequence, the badge earner can navigate the TestStand environment to modify test steps, modify test logic and use debugging tools to identify and correct errors and warnings. This badge is earned by acquiring a set of required badges.
ede891b2-af4a-4235-ac38-dc22abd7fcba.name: TestStand Navigation and Diagnostics

d3a4cf29-ba19-42b0-9b62-c5f27e083b4b.description: SystemLink System Setup badge holder can install and configure SystemLink on a host and one or more targets to begin managing your systems and deploying packages. This badge earner is able to set up SystemLink Server on the host from NI Package Manager then set up SystemLink Client on the target. Once you set up your SystemLink server and clients, you can use NI SystemLink Web Application to view and manage your clients, deploy packages, and transfer data from clients to the server.
d3a4cf29-ba19-42b0-9b62-c5f27e083b4b.name: SystemLink Setup

c6441578-03de-4d99-bd68-b6315fb1788b.description: Given an oscilloscope specifications sheet and/or user manual, this badge earner is able to select an oscilloscope with the required performance and then use the oscilloscope to accurately acquire measurements.
c6441578-03de-4d99-bd68-b6315fb1788b.name: Oscilloscopes

5c8449df-aea5-40a1-a742-24229393db98.description: LabVIEW Champions are National Instruments platform enthusiasts who have been recognized for their exceptional application development, technical depth and breadth, leadership, and contributions to the LabVIEW community. These individuals are positive contributors, advocating for the NI platform while providing constructive feedback. LabVIEW Champions are third-party individuals who have received recognition from National Instruments for their outstanding contributions to the success of LabVIEW.
5c8449df-aea5-40a1-a742-24229393db98.name: LabVIEW Champion

badge_template_activities.title: Attain experience utilizing the National Instruments LabVIEW platform
Actively participate in the LabVIEW community
Complete National Instruments Champion application citing accomplishments and community contributions
Selected as Champion by National Instruments Champion Coordinators

2fe92d84-2eac-4816-b4c2-af5c9342ae7d.description: LabVIEW NXG Programming Fundamentals badge holders can build functional VIs that effectively use structures, clusters and arrays. The badge earner is able to identify order of execution from dataflow paradigm and use LabVIEW NXG to build simple VIs with bundled data, loops, arrays and SubVIs.
2fe92d84-2eac-4816-b4c2-af5c9342ae7d.name: LabVIEW NXG Programming Fundamentals

a22d590f-f5ae-457c-af86-09fca4562a1c.description: LabVIEW NXG Environment badge earners can demonstrate familiarity with the built-in tools and key features of the LabVIEW NXG environment. Given a project, the badge earner can execute a VI and capture panel data, and can use this data to validate and test hardware connected to the system.
a22d590f-f5ae-457c-af86-09fca4562a1c.name: LabVIEW NXG Environment

6b7c593a-bba9-4985-a4b7-dd88cbbf1306.description: SystemLink Configuration and Deployment badge holders can create a package and deploy it to all your managed systems. This badge earner is able to upload packages to the SystemLink server for clients to access and add feeds containing packages to SystemLink clients.
6b7c593a-bba9-4985-a4b7-dd88cbbf1306.name: SystemLink Configuration and Deployment

3773c7a2-6e1e-49bd-8a85-033e16713478.description: The badge earner can manage dependencies and settings for the deployment of a test program. The badge earner can select the correct settings, create and populate a workspace, manage sequence file and station dependencies, and create, modify, & organize custom data types. This badge is earned by passing the related assessment.
3773c7a2-6e1e-49bd-8a85-033e16713478.name: TestStand Dependency Management

9167449d-9453-4e28-917b-2c9831f4b19d.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated their ability to use the Actor Framework to build components for inherently parallel, scalable, and modular LabVIEW systems. Content covered in the badge includes design principles for Actor systems, implementation of UI actors and helper loops, management of nested actors, error handling, and developer productivity tooling.
9167449d-9453-4e28-917b-2c9831f4b19d.name: Actor Framework

b9b2ce57-0442-4555-b19c-6a4578cde215.description: LabVIEW NXG Sequential Programming badge holders can build a readable, modular and scalable sequencer VI. The badge earner can develop modular sequential VIs for single use, one-off applications. The badges earner can use the Open-read-write-close model for accessing resources in LabVIEW NXG.
b9b2ce57-0442-4555-b19c-6a4578cde215.name: LabVIEW NXG Sequential Programming

9bf41591-b11d-42e4-be62-82ccd7f9209d.description: LabVIEW NXG Troubleshooting Code badge holders can use LabVIEW NXG troubleshooting tools to debug LabVIEW NXG code. This badge holder can use LabVIEW NXG troubleshooting tools to identify the probable cause of broken run arrows, errors generated when code is run, and unexpected results in data collection and analysis.
9bf41591-b11d-42e4-be62-82ccd7f9209d.name: LabVIEW NXG Troubleshooting Code

fe528f90-86c9-4c6b-90b7-2a7540cf2a68.description: The badge earner can use the TestStand Expression Editor to manipulate edit-time and runtime variables. The badge earner understands the objects hierarchy and inheritance, can create and modify objects dynamically, and can access the API outside of TestStand.
fe528f90-86c9-4c6b-90b7-2a7540cf2a68.name: TestStand API

e8c9c351-0cdf-4f73-8c7d-1645adf78e25.description: LabVIEW NXG Programming badge holders can build a simple looping or sequencer VI from scratch for single-shot use. This badge earner is able to use the LabVIEW NXG environment, dataflow programming, and common LabVIEW NXG development techniques. They can create applications using the state machine design pattern to acquire, process, display, and store real-world data.
e8c9c351-0cdf-4f73-8c7d-1645adf78e25.name: LabVIEW NXG Programming

68099994-3ed0-4ce0-b98c-4fd00961b941.description: DIAdem Interactive Visualization badge holders can use DIAdem interactively to query, load and inspect a data set. For those tasked with evaluating and reporting a data set, use DIAdem in a configuration based capacity to perform tasks on-demand.
68099994-3ed0-4ce0-b98c-4fd00961b941.name: DIAdem Interactive Visualization

a658724d-dee7-4fd8-879e-aab93248f911.description: Certified LabWindows™/CVI Developers (CCVID) demonstrate proficiency in design and development of C programs using the LabWindows/CVI environment, a proven ANSI C development environment for test and measurement. CCVIDs have a solid understanding of the LabWindows/CVI environment and its capabilities and can develop multi-threaded applications with functional user interfaces and inter-application communication.
a658724d-dee7-4fd8-879e-aab93248f911.name: Certified LabWindows™/CVI Developer (CCVID)

383254c9-a32d-49e9-82a3-c72c6dee3beb.description: The LabVIEW NXG Distributing Code badge holder is able to identify the distribution needs of their planned code, prepare a LabVIEW NXG project for distribution, and build and distribute LabVIEW applications and packages.
383254c9-a32d-49e9-82a3-c72c6dee3beb.name: LabVIEW NXG Distributing Code

61daa745-fb04-4022-bc50-2e0b78ce5c6f.description: Given a DMM and Oscilloscope, this badge earner is able to acquire and log signals for troubleshooting purposes. This badge earner can select, configure, and connect the appropriate instrument for the measurement need and then capture and log data or debug unexpected signals.
61daa745-fb04-4022-bc50-2e0b78ce5c6f.name: Troubleshooting Measurements
